thread.title: Cleveland square renovations on track for GOP convention
thread.title_full: Cleveland square renovations on track for GOP convention

title: Cleveland square renovations on track for GOP convention
text:
Renovations of Cleveland's Public Square on track to be done by GOP convention, official says 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/12/15 8:18 am EDT - Updated: 10/12/15 8:18 am EDT 
CLEVELAND â€” The head of a nonprofit civic organization overseeing improvements to Cleveland's Public Square says the renovations are on track to be done by the time the city hosts the Republican National Convention. 
The Plain Dealer ( http://bit.ly/1jqYi8w ) reports key parts are taking shape after crews worked double shifts during summer to take advantage of good weather before winter. Primary underground utilities and dozens of new trees are in place. Workers are installing molded concrete benches and planter retaining walls that will form sleek arcs from the ground. 
Jeremy Paris, of the Group Plan Commission, says the renovation should be completed by July. 
The cost rose from $32 million to $37 million. Some of the increase is a contingency in case work must be accelerated to compensate for bad weather or problems. 
Information from: The Plain Dealer, http://www.cleveland.com
